content.description:
Center route on "beginners paradise" face. Start on a sweet pocket and move up on sweet crimps

Shares a 2 bolt anchor with "Go Your Own Way" and "Meow Mix" as well.
content.location: Center most route on beginner's  paradise face.

content.description: awkward face/arete climbing at start leads to crux before the most amazing flake.
content.protection: several bolts to to bolt anchors over lip.  Chains will be there soon.
content.location: Above the Scattered Boulders area on eastern face on steep double overhanging feature.

content.description: unknown awesome looking sport route. more info coming soon...
unknow sport problem. more info soon

Its the left side of a wall covered in graffiti, not sure what it is suposed to be called, only Tr ed it once but wanted people to know it existed

will work on getting Pics and more info soon
content.location: left side of wall covered in graffiti

content.description: Easy crack with a variety of options.  You can climb the crack using jams, lie back, or pull the face.  Great way to practice placing gear.
content.protection: medium gear and 1 quick draw to top or just top rope it.
content.location: Obvious crack up Beginners Paradise face

content.description:
Climb in the cove past boldge to chains.

Disclaimer I have not climbed this and do not know if its rating is accurate I just wanted to let people know it exists.
content.protection: 1 bolt to chains the first bolt can be stiick cliped from a small cove but it is maybe 12-15 feet off the ground making it PG-13 or R without a stick clip
content.location: From the top of airport hill turn left and park and hike northward along the base of the rock wall for 5-10 min

content.description: Easy warm up route for beginners using positive varnished holds to the top
content.location: right most route on beginners paradise face

content.description: From the top of airport hill turn left and hike along the base of the wall northward and it will be on your Right.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a nice 2 bolt anchor
content.location: It is just to the left of Hotter than a Supernova. Hike 100 feet or so northward past Hotter than a Supernova along the base of the wall.

content.description:
Share 1st and 4th bolt with "Go Your Own Way" on awesome pocket and crimp and move left along arete on decent crimper holds.

Shares a 2 bolt anchor with "Go Your Own Way" and "Wonder Woman" as well.
content.location: Left most route on bigginner paradise face. Left most area of Arial Wall

content.description: Starts with some medium pockets and then traverses across the face to the left where there are some hard crimps that lead to a large ledge and some flakes.
content.protection: 2 anchors at the top require slings to set up a top rope. They are the anchors that are on the flat rock not the slanted ones next to it.
content.location: Get to the top of airport hill and turn left then park in the dirt lot.  Scramble us the rocks along the Ridgeline till you see the face with 4 bolts going to the top. Scramble up to the top of that face and there are two sets of 2 bolt anchors, use either set.

content.description: There are a few medium pockets for your feet at the start witch lead up to several ledges. There is a good sized ledge to practice manteling on your left about 1/3 the way up. Then there is a big pocket with rounded edges to your right. After this there is are several more ledges then a small harder section with barely any holds and a small crack to toe jam in. Once you get pass that there are several large pockets as well as flakes to the two bolt anchors.
content.protection:
This route has 4 bolts up to a two bolt anchor.

If you want to set up a top rope you can scramble up to the top of the rock face on some easy 3rd class to the right.
content.location:
This route is located in the South-Eastern corner of St. George UT. Follow River Road south from downtown and turn left onto 2450 South Street. Then turn right onto South 3000 East. After a while turn left onto Banded Hills DR and continue up the road to the top. There will be a big rock wall to your left and there is are several turnoffs to park at. Aerial Wall is the wall to the left and right of the road but turn left or toward the North. Get out from your car and fallow the trail at the base of the wall Northward toward Pine Valley MT. After just a minuet or so you will see "Hotter than a Supernova" witch faces South-West.

If you want to set up a top rope you can scramble up to the top of the rock face on some easy 3-4th class.

content.description: shares the same start as hectors 11 but moves left toward the end with an extra bolt to separate anchors
Easy face that moves up along left side of crack. Start with feet  around the crack and move up and left in the direction of the bolts
content.location: Right most bolted route of "beginners paradise" face.

content.description: Super fun route with interesting and technical beta lead to fun moves. Over all just aan awesome route.
content.location: rightmost route on insane overhang feature

content.description:
Left side of face that shares the 1st and 4th bolt with "Meow Mix". Start on pocket and crimp and move strait up along crimper to lower anchors an left.

Shares a 2 bolt anchor with "Meow Mix" and "Wonder Woman" as well.
content.location: 2nd to left route on beginners paradise face.

content.description: Super fun route that moves up and and then traverses right on lower roof along super awesome pockets and heel hooks.  Has awesome heel hand match crux just before anchors.
content.protection: several bolts to two bolt anchor. I believe 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor
content.location: lower roof of double roof feature.

content.description:
Not much is know but it will be sent soon.

If you know the real name/ any info let me know.

Disclaimer I have not climbed this and do not know if its rating is accurate I just wanted to let people know it exists.
content.protection:
4-6 bolts to an anchor? Itâs only pg13 or R without a stick clip.

The first bolt is probably 10-12 feet off the ground.
content.location: It is left of Hotter then a Suppernova and accessed by a 5-10 min hike northward along the bottom of the rock face.
